author: g11tech
content:
we can try devnet5 with old images since the codebase has moved, the issue in devnet5 was fork in network .most likely beacuse of ethereumjs not accepting a minted transaction from geth which was accessing BLOBHASH through a static call)

But it was fixed, however none of the nodes could catch up with lighthouse nodes (which seemed to be only surviving nodes with latest head) as they were rate limiting most probably, only made worse by the fact that the network had not been finalizing since fork.

author: g11tech
content:
So the following are the issues with their status and  concerns:

1. [Fixed] Ethereumjs rejected the block which caused fork
2. [Fixed] Nimbus was having issue serving blobs which it was fixed i think
3. [Unknown] Failing sync from lighthouse nodes most probably rate limited, but i am not sure

Concern:
1. We moved past the blob availability window at one point, so the sync from genesis was not possible.
However the last finalized was still in blob availability window when i tried the sync (and hence was able to sync till hitting the rate limiting issue) .

But now if one wants to sync from lighthouse, it wouldn't be unless leaking validators have been exited from lighthouse and its finalized (most likely). So a weak subjectivity sync from lighthouse should now work if lighthouse nodes are still up, but ELs would need to beacon sync which brings to the other concern:

2. EL peering issue (if any) since ELs were not getting peered (most likely some config issue), and the beacon sync of the blobs which I am not sure if ELs were correctlty ssz serializing the blob txs in their payload bodies (however not an issue in devnet 6 since its RLP now)

author: g11tech
content: Since there has been so much flux, I am less inclined to run another devnet with devnet5 specs, however I can push for lodestar<>ethereumjs combo on devnet 6 specs most likely on weekend for the PRs mentioned on the devnet 6 spec , so that other nodes can dev and sync against it?

author: g11tech
content: (and we can repro the sync issues in devnet 6 towards its end by shutting down nodes and letting it run non finalized, and then sync and finalize again)
